intro: Carpesium leptophyllum, commonly known as the slenderleaf thistle, is a perennial flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and milky sap. The plant features narrow, gray-green leaves with a rough texture, and it produces yellow to orange composite flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a hardy species in desert landscapes.
